head.title: Mariners Shut Out Yankees in Opener

hedline.hl1: Mariners Shut Out Yankees in Opener

block.p: The Seattle Mariners defeated the punchless Yankees, 2-0, last night in the opening game of the American League Championship Series.

On a cold night in the Bronx, Freddy Garcia held the dormant Yankee offense to three hits in six and two-thirds innings. Besides a six-run outburst in the first inning against Oakland -- leading to a victory in the decisive game of the division series -- the Yankees have scored only 13 runs in the other 52 innings of the playoffs.
The Seattle Mariners defeated the punchless Yankees, 2-0, last night in the opening game of the American League Championship Series.

On a cold night in the Bronx, Freddy Garcia held the dormant Yankee offense to three hits in six and two-thirds innings. Besides a six-run outburst in the first inning against Oakland -- leading to a victory in the decisive game of the division series -- the Yankees have scored only 13 runs in the other 52 innings of the playoffs.

The Mariners, the league's wild-card entrant, were held hitless for four and two-thirds innings. But Rickey Henderson, a former Yankee and Met, hit a run-scoring single in the fifth inning, and Alex Rodriguez led off the sixth with a home run.
Game 2 of the four-of-seven series is today at Yankee Stadium. The National League Championship Series begins tonight in St. Louis, where the Cardinals play host to the Mets.
